summary: This is a stipulation filed in the Southern District of New York in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (S2 20 CR 330). The parties agree that a transcript of a sworn statement taken on November 21, 2005 in West Palm Beach, Florida is a true and accurate copy and may be received as evidence at trial, subject to standard objections.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell

events.title: Sworn Statement Taken
events.description: A sworn statement was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida. The transcript of this statement is the subject of the stipulation.

events.title: Stipulation Filed
events.description: The prosecution and defense stipulate to the authenticity of a 2005 transcript for use as evidence in the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The parties in Ghislaine Maxwell's criminal case stipulated that a transcript of a sworn statement from November 21, 2005 is authentic.
The 2005 sworn statement was taken in West Palm Beach, Florida.
The stipulation, filed in November 2021, allows the transcript to be received as evidence at trial subject to standard legal objections.
Ghislaine Maxwell was represented by attorneys Christopher Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
The prosecution was represented by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams and Assistant U.S. Attorneys.
